Package fr.alanguenegou.prd.prdapp.graph

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.alanguenegou.prd.prdapp.graph.Graph
  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    The class modelling a city road network (here, the city of Tours, France)
    Version:
    1.00

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static double[] LINEAR_COMBINATION_DISTANCE_WEIGHTS
      Constant giving to the entire app the different distance weights used to compute an artificial Pareto front
      static int WITH_ALTERNATIVE_DANGER_VALUE
      Constant for pointing out what type of danger value will be used by the shortest path algorithm
      static int WITH_INITIAL_DANGER_VALUE
      Constant for pointing out what type of danger value will be used by the shortest path algorithm

      • calculateShortestPathFromSourceToSink

        public static org.javatuples.Pair<java.util.List<Node>,​java.lang.Double> calculateShortestPathFromSourceToSink​(Node source,
                                                                                                                     Node sink,
                                                                                                                     double distanceWeight,
                                                                                                                     int useOfDangerValue)
        Calculates the shortest-path from a source node to a sink node in this graph (based on the Dijkstra algorithm)
        Parameters:
        source - The starting node
        sink - The ending node
        distanceWeight - The attributed distance weight in the linear combination (distance, danger)
        useOfDangerValue - A numerical value defining if alternative (= 1) danger value or initial (= 2) one is used for the shortest-path calculation
        Returns:
        The node list that represents the shortest-path from the source to the sink and its total cost

      • calculateLabelsForManyLinearCombinations

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Double,​org.javatuples.Pair<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double>> calculateLabelsForManyLinearCombinations​(Node source,
                                                                                                                                                       Node sink,
                                                                                                                                                       int useOfDangerValue)
        Computes the labels (distance, danger) of a shortest-path, for numerous linear combination weights
        Parameters:
        source - The starting node of the path request
        sink - The ending node of the path request
        useOfDangerValue - A numerical value defining if alternative (= 1) danger value or initial (= 2) one is used for the shortest-path calculation
        Returns:
        A HashMap containing the distance and danger values for X linear combinations (see LINEAR_COMBINATION_DISTANCE_WEIGHTS)

      • checkLinearCombinationAmount

        public void checkLinearCombinationAmount​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Double,​org.javatuples.Pair<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double>> labels)
        Checks if, for a specific path request, its labels are close enough to each other, or if an additional linear combination between two is needed
        Parameters:
        labels - The pareto front of a computed shortest-path

      • printNumberOfNodesHavingOnePredecessorAndSuccessor

        public void printNumberOfNodesHavingOnePredecessorAndSuccessor()
        Prints the number of nodes in this graph that only have one predecessor and one successor

      • prepareNewCalculation

        public void prepareNewCalculation()
        Prepares new calculation of a path by resetting distance and path attributes of every node of this graph

      • modifyGraph

        public void modifyGraph​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,​java.lang.Integer> modifications)
        Applies a set of modifications to the Danger value of some specific nodes of this graph
        Parameters:
        modifications - A HashMap that contains each section on which we want to apply a modification ({section ID, new security factor})
